problem_statement: The objective is to author a high-rigor, full-coverage test suite for a Python-based Sliding Window Rate Limiter. The service is designed to limit API requests within a rolling temporal window (e.g., 60 seconds). Your task is to verify that the limiter correctly handles high-frequency bursts, ensures that old data is purged to prevent memory leaks, and remains accurate under complex, non-linear request patterns. The test suite must utilize property-based testing to prove that the 'sliding' property holds true for any arbitrary sequence of timestamps, ensuring no more than the allowed threshold of requests ever occurs within any 60-second slice.
